topic: ABS Plastic in the Automotive Industry
trends: Increased use of ABS for lightweighting to improve fuel efficiency and EV range.
Development of enhanced ABS grades with improved scratch resistance and UV stability for exterior applications.
Growing demand for sustainable ABS, including recycled and bio-based alternatives.
Integration of ABS in advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) components.
Focus on ABS formulations that can withstand higher temperatures for under-the-hood applications.
Advancements in 3D printing with ABS for rapid prototyping and custom automotive parts.

data_points.statistic: The global ABS market size in the automotive sector was valued at USD 34.52 billion in 2023 and is projected to grow at a CAGR of 6.8% from 2024 to 2030.
Lightweighting initiatives in the automotive industry aim to reduce vehicle weight by up to 10% through material substitution, with ABS playing a key role.
ABS components can offer a weight reduction of up to 20-30% compared to traditional metal parts they replace.
